glossary.definition: A specific job role or function within the organization
A template defining the requirements, responsibilities, and qualifications for a position
The association of an employee with a specific position
The reporting and career progression relationships between positions

business_rules: Positions must be associated with organizational units
Job profiles define the standard requirements for positions
Employees can be assigned to positions based on profile match
Position changes require approval and documentation
Job profiles can be versioned for updates
Positions can have reporting relationships to other positions
Position assignments affect employee access and permissions
Position history must be maintained for each employee
Positions can be vacant or filled
calculations_or_formulas: Average time in position = average of (end_date - start_date) for completed assignments
invariants: Position must be associated with valid organizational unit
Position assignment must have valid employee and position
Position assignment dates must be valid (start <= end if end exists)
Employee cannot have overlapping position assignments
Job profile must have at least one requirement defined
edge_cases: Employee is assigned to multiple positions - system allows or prevents based on policy
Position is eliminated - system handles current assignments, may require reassignment or termination
Job profile is updated - system versions profile, maintains assignments to previous version or migrates
Position assignment dates overlap - system prevents overlap or handles transition period
Employee transfers between positions - system creates new assignment, ends old assignment, maintains history
Position reporting relationship creates cycle - system prevents cycle, flags error
Position is vacant for extended period - system flags vacancy, may trigger recruitment
Job profile requirements change - system updates profile, may require reassessment of current employees
compliance_requirements: Position assignments must be documented and approved
Job profile requirements must comply with labor regulations
Position history must be retained for audit purposes
Position changes must be communicated to affected employees
Job profile updates must maintain version history
user_journeys: HR creates position - defines title, unit, and profile, position is available for assignment
HR creates job profile - defines requirements and qualifications, profile is available for positions
HR assigns employee to position - creates assignment with effective date, employee is notified
Employee transfers to new position - old assignment ends, new assignment begins, history is maintained
HR updates job profile - new version is created, positions using profile are notified
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given position creation, when title and unit are provided, then position is created and available for assignment
Given position assignment, when employee and position are valid, then assignment is created and employee is notified
Given position transfer, when new assignment is created, then old assignment ends and history is maintained
Given job profile update, when requirements are modified, then profile is versioned and positions are notified
Given position elimination, when position is deleted, then current assignments are handled (reassignment or termination)
open_questions: What are the specific position types? (full-time? part-time? contractor?)
How are job profile requirements validated? (automatic? manual review?)
What is the process for position transfers? (approval required? automatic?)
How are position reporting relationships defined? (direct manager? matrix reporting?)
What happens when position is eliminated? (reassign employees? terminate?)
How are job profile versions managed? (maintain all? migrate assignments?)
assumptions: Positions are associated with organizational units
Job profiles define standard requirements for positions
Position history is maintained for each employee
Job profiles can be versioned for updates
